title: Two Intervals
text: We have to write two intervals for this problem.

title: Interval $$1$$
text: The first interval must indicate all real numbers less than $$-2$$.

title: Interval Notation
text: How to represent all real numbers less than $$b$$, but not including $$b$$? Remember that the parenthesis indicates that the number is not included in the set.

title: Interval $$1$$
text: Let's apply the above principle to our problem!

title: Interval $$2$$
text: The second interval must indicate all real numbers greater than or equal to $$3$$.

title: Interval Notation
text: How to represent all real numbers greater than a, including a? Remember that the bracket indicates that the number is included in the set.

title: Interval $$2$$
text: Let's apply the above principle to our problem!

title: Combination
text: We want to combine these two sets and we can accomplish this by inserting the union symbol, U, between the two intervals.
